utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Can you believe it’s been five years since our first date?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know. Do you think I should start watching The Flash TV show?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s what you’re thinking about?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, one of the things.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are any of them me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. I thought, I can’t decide if I should watch The Flash TV show. I know, I’ll ask Amy. Anyway.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re right, you did kind of kill the mood.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I didn’t kill anything. You did, talking about your stupid TV show.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me. Starting to watch a television show that might run for years isn’t a decision to take lightly. I’m wrestling with a big commitment issue here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Really? That’s the commitment issue you’re wrestling with? Sheldon, do you understand the irony of your fixation on a man with super speed, while after five years all I can get out of you is a distracted make-out session on a couch?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Irony’s not really my strong suit. But I have been getting better with sarcasm, if you want to give that a try.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, sure, I’d love to.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Whenever you’re ready.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I don’t want to rush you, but I’m closing a little early tonight.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh. Hot date?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Uh, no. I overheard Bernadette tell Howard she was making him a meat loaf, and you don’t have to not ask me twice.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: If I stick a light bulb on this, wouldn’t it make a great lamp for my bedroom?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re kidding, right?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh. Is this freaking you out?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I guess I’m just more of a Pottery Barn, Crate and Barrel kind of guy. Maybe Pier 1 if I really want to cut loose.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: All right. Never mind.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, no, no. Hey, you should totally get it. In fact, I’ll buy it for you.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Sold.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Raj, you don’t have to do that.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Too late. No returns.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That was really intense.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, now we know, next time we go to the farmers’ market, the order is petting zoo first, then buy vegetables.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, good. You’re here. I need your assistance.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can it wait until I put a Band-Aid on a goat bite?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, your buddy got mugged by some baby farm animals.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Been there.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mmm. So what do you need help with?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy’s mad at me, and I’m not clear why.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Were you talking before she got upset?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s probably it. What’d you say to her?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I just asked her if I should start watching the new Flash TV series.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And that made her angry?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Baffling, right? We were necking like a couple of hooligans under the school bleachers. I stopped so I could ask the question. Next thing I know, good-bye, kissy face. Hello, yelly face.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, Sheldon, when you’re kissing a girl, she expects the attention to be on her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It was. I asked her if she thought I should watch The Flash.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. I’m tapping out. Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m gonna guess that your main concern is the time commitment of watching an entire season of a new show.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no, not just a season. If I’m in, I’m in for the whole run, even if the quality declines.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I get it. Smallville almost wrecked you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah. Exactly. You know, I waited ten years to see a guy everyone knows can fly, fly.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wait, what is wrong with you two? He was talking about television during their date night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, not just date night, our fifth anniversary.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, see, that’s even dumber than you wondering if being bitten by a goat would give you the powers of a goat.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If that happens, don’t make me wait ten years to watch you eat a tin can.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You guys ever notice that Emily has a bit of a twisted side?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You mean ’cause she has weird tattoos?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, because she wants to have sex with me in a graveyard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: One more time?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: She and I were supposed to watch the new Avengers movie tonight, but it was sold out. So I said, what else do you want to do? She said, let’s go to a cemetery and do it on somebody’s grave.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Like, a random person or somebody she knew?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What difference does it make?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, if it’s her father’s grave and they didn’t get along, then you know she holds a grudge.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: The only issue is that everybody has their own thing, and as long as it’s two consenting adults, I guess I don’t see the harm in it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, what if it’s one consenting adult and one adult who pretends to consent because he’s afraid of being alone?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, then I guess bring a blanket. The grass gets damp at night.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t know, guys. Maybe this relationship isn’t for me. Maybe I should break up with her.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Right. You’re gonna break up with a girl who has sex with you. Can you believe this guy?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I think if Raj wants to break up with a girl, he can do it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How are you saying that with a straight face?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You guys are being jerks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Buddy, other than Jenny Craig, you’ve never broken up with a girl in your life.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re one to talk. You’ve been complaining about Stuart living here for the past year. I don’t see you showing him the door.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s not the same thing. Emily’s a person. Stuart’s more like an infestation, something you spray for.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Baloney, okay? You two are as afraid of hurting someone’s feelings as I am.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That’s not true. We were just laughing right in your face.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thanks for cooking.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mmm. My pleasure.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That carrot was delicious.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. I wish I’d fought harder for the rest of ’em.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Still haven’t heard from her?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, and I’m confused. It’s been nearly 24 hours. Amy should have figured out she’s wrong by now.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, I don’t think she’s wrong about you going too slow in the relationship.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Too slow?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, you’ve been going out for years. You haven’t even slept together.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s right. It’s called foreplay. And I could make the case that you two aren’t moving forward in your relationship.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, hello.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. Sheldon, we’re getting married.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But you’ve been engaged for over a year now, and you don’t even have a wedding date.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, we will. We’re just not in a rush.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re gonna set a date.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. If you say so.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s just, things are good right now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really good.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m focusing on my job.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And we’ve been busy with our paper.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So busy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, we’ll pick a date when we pick a date.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, I can see why Amy’s mad at you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, shut up, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Did you eat all my yoghurt?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You mean the one that makes ladies do the thing that ladies pretend they don’t do even though they do?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You know which yoghurt I mean.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I didn’t touch it. Must have been Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Maybe Raj is right. Maybe it’s time we tell him he needs to move out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We should have done it months ago.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I know, but his store was reopening, and then there were the holidays, and then he was sick.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, right. Sick. He didn’t have jaundice. He just looks like that.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: All right. Tonight’s the night.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Agreed. When he gets home, I’m dropping the hammer.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Ooh, I like when you take charge.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, I’m not taking charge, you’re the hammer.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, why haven’t we picked a date?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know why.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, of course I know why. But just for fun, why?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Not in a rush, busy with work…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Things are good right now.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really good.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You still want to get married, right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Yes. Why would you even ask that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know. Because we don’t have a date?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you want a date, pick a date.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not just the date. We haven’t talked about anything. Big wedding, small wedding, indoor, outdoor?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Outdoor? Oh. I can RSVP no right now.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, indoor it is. Big or small?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is your dad paying for it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I doubt it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, two friends each.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, well, I want it in a church.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine. I want black-tie.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fine. I want to release butterflies.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Seriously? Airborne worms?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay. Well, then it’s settled. Small indoor church wedding, black-tie, no butterflies.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sounds perfect.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You still didn’t pick a date.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Stay out of it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Mmm. It’s a beautiful night.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, yes, we’ve got the moon and the trees and Elizabeth McNulty, who apparently died when she was the same age I am.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Makes you feel alive, doesn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So does enjoying a meal at a well-lit restaurant, but here we are.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You aren’t scared, are you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Of ghosts, no. Of you, little bit.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry I’ve upset you. I shouldn’t have asked so many questions.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, it’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe it’s good you got us talking about this stuff.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, look at that, even when I’m causing problems, I make the world a better place. Hey, next, why don’t we tackle your penchant for whining and Penny’s love of the ol’ glug-glug?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, Sheldon, I think we’re good for now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ah, well, very well. So does this mean you’ll finally pick a wedding date?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Here we go again. Why is everyone so concerned with us setting a date? We’re committed to each other. We’re happy. A ceremony isn’t gonna change anything.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So you’re never getting married? It’s his whining, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, I’m not a whiner.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s amusing that he doesn’t hear it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, all she’s saying is we are in love so it doesn’t matter if we get married tomorrow or a year from now or 50 years from now.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ew, 50? We’ll be old and gross.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, but we’ll be old and gross together.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My aunt and uncle were married 63 years. Towards the end, it was like watching cheese melt.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, I’m free tonight.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you saying you want to get married?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Vegas isn’t that far away.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m in. Let’s do it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: After all these years. I’m really happy for the two of you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now get out of my spot.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bernie, Stuart just pulled up. So remember, the key is to be firm. Show no weakness.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Good luck.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard Joel Wolowitz, you get back here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Never should have told you my middle name.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, you got a minute?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Sure. Uh, let me just put this stuff in the fridge. I felt bad for finishing your yoghurt, so I bought more. And, Howard, your favourite fruit is in season. Crunch Berries.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Don’t let that sway you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s hard not to. They taste so much better than real berries.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So, we need to talk.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I think we should talk.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, you’ve been living here a while now.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I know. I may sell comic books at work, but the real superheroes are sitting right in front of me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: His middle name is David. Go.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Look, I care about you a lot, but we are very different people.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Are you breaking up with me?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, no, I’m just pointing out that you’re dark on the inside and I’m dark on the outside.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So, anyway, what I’m trying to say is…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You need to take that?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: It’s just my dad, probably calling to wish me a happy birthday. I’ll call him back. You were saying?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Look, Raj, be honest with me. If you want to end things, just do it. Don’t expect me to do it for you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: End things? I’m trying to tell you that I love you.

utterance.speaker: Howard and Bernadette (singing)
utterance.content: Happy birthday to you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow, there’s a Denny’s in Vegas you can actually get married in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Doesn’t sound very romantic.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, but we could get heart-shaped pancakes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sure we’ll find a decent chapel.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. This is crazy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know. You think people are gonna be mad?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Maybe. But this isn’t about them, it’s about us.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It is. It is about us.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And you know what the best part is? We took our time. I mean, we met, we were friends for a couple years, then we got together, and then we got untogether, then we worked out all our problems, and now we know everything about each other, we can just go forward with no surprises and no regrets.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right. No surprises.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And no regrets.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, well, there, there’s one thing I feel I should tell you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, so we can go into this with no secrets between us.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Remember, uh, a couple years back when I was on that research ship in the North Sea?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, well, there, there was a lot of drinking and craziness going on.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, you told me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, um, well, there was this girl.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What did you do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nothing really. It was just kissing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And then what?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And then nothing. I stopped it. But it still bothers me, and I wanted you to know.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Did you ever do anything like this since we’ve been?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Nope, never.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, that’s too bad.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, can I ask you a question?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why are you telling me this now?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, like I said, we’re about to get married, and I, I want a clean slate. No secrets.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? Because to me, it seems like we’re about to get married and you’re trying to sabotage it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Would you rather I didn’t tell you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I don’t want there to be secrets between us.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: See, now I’m confused. I mean, what, what am I supposed to do?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, keep your mouth off other women.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can do that. Uh, uh, from now on, this mouth, you and food, that’s it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, I’m not happy this happened, but I think I can get past it. I mean, we weren’t engaged at the time, and it was just kissing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Just kissing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It wasn’t even very good. She was a smoker, I’d just been seasick.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, that’s enough. Stop talking.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, we’re still getting married?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because we love each other.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And it’s the happiest day of our lives.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ha-ha, don’t push it.

utterance.speaker: Amy (on skype)
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello. Listen, I’ve been thinking a lot about relationships and how difficult they can be, and I think…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’ve been thinking about them, too, Sheldon. Being your girlfriend is so challenging. Emotionally, physically. I’ve been incredibly patient for years.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Strongly disagree. Go on.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, well, this isn’t easy to say, because I love you, but I need some time to take a step back and re-evaluate our situation.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I hope you understand.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Bye, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, Gollum, you’re an expert on rings. What do I do with this one?
